alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 8:52AM CDT until March 30 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LOGAN...EASTERN JOHNSON...NORTH CENTRAL YELL AND NORTHWESTERN POPE COUNTIES... At 852 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Rosetta to near Holman to near Knoxville, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Russellville... Clarksville... Lamar... Dover... London... Knoxville... Dillen... Broomfield... Devils Knob... Lake Dardanelle... Spadra... Bertha... Tokalon... Taral... Holman... Rosetta... Fort Douglas... Lutherville... Dublin... Long Pool Campground... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 57 and 80. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for western, central and north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
